page.title: 09EDUCATION
page.content: There are two schools in Billingborough-the County Primary School for infant and junior school children and the Aveland School for secondary school age children. The primary school accepts children at the age of five years and they stay there until they are eleven.The number on roll at present is 56.They are taught a wide range of subjects, English,Maths,Geography, History,Art and Craft, Music, P.E., Religious Education and Computer Technology. The selection examination is still taken at 11 years those not attending Grammar School in Sleaford go to the Aveland School.The school has approx. 300 children and 12 teachers.The curriculum covers a wide range of subjects up to "o" level certificate standard.Further education entails travelling out of the area.
